page.title: 19Organic farming
page.content: Charles and Carolyn Wacher have 22 acres of land leading down to the Aeron. On 10 acres of this land are grown organic vegetables. This means that unlike some farms in the area, they use no ARTIFICIAL chemicals or fertilisers. Instead they use a lot of horse/cow manure and they make compost from vegetable waste, straw, weeds, and when the compost is ready they spread it onto the ground or dig it in to maintain the fertility. As the climate is severe they need polythene greenhouses, 7 in all in which to get early crops of tomatoes, cucumbers, and courgettes. They sell the vegetables almost entirely to local shops in the Lampeter and Tregaron area. At the weekly markets the people of Llangeitho buy the Wachers' organic vegetables because they taste better.
